original: Brovik, Åke Bertil, konstnär, Göteborg, f. 24/1/11 i Gbg av krimin:komm. V. E. Nilsson o. Hulda Svenungsson. G. 39 m. Birgit Wirde. Barn: Ingela f. 43, Bertil 45. — Stud :ex. 30, stud. v. h. konsthantv:sk., SSF sk. i Gbg 31-35. Stud:res. i Frankr., Schweiz, Norge, Danm., Tyskl. o. Tjeckoslov. Medarb. i Gbgs Morgonpost 35-38, teckn:lär :vik. v. flera tillf. v. Vasa h. a. l., h. konsthantv:sk. (SSF) o. komm. mellansk., freelancer, arr. Gbgs Mus. Skråutst. 46, utf. väggmåln. i i Schwedenhaus i Zürich 47. Spec. porträttmåleri. Illustr. ett flertal böcker. Utställn. i Eskilstuna konstmus. 44, Falu stads konsthall 45, Upps. o. Örebro 46, utställn. av handtryck på tyg i Nat:mus., Röhsska mus. o. Liljevalchs, repr. m. teckn. o. måln. i kulturhist. avd. v. Gbgs mus. Medl. av Konstn. riksorg.. Sv. slöjdfören. facksekt. 44, Palette d’Or, hed:led. av Instituto de Cultura Americana 46, av Accademia Culturale Adriatica i Milano 47, suppl i styr. f. Societas Sanctae Apolloniae 46, led. av fören. Sv:es flotta. Sv. journ:fören. 35-39, Gbgs motorkl., Gbgs konsthantverkare o. Konsthantv. gille i Sthlm 47. Hobby: ex libris. Ordre Universel du Mérite Humain, Societas Sanctae Apolloniaes hed:t.
translated: Brovik, Åke Bertil, artist, Gothenburg, born January 24, 1911, in Gothenburg, the son of police commissioner V. E. Nilsson and Hulda Svenungsson. Married Birgit Wirde in 1939. They had two children, Ingela (born 1943) and Bertil (born 1945). Åke passed his final high school exam in 1930 and studied at the School of Arts and Crafts in Gothenburg and at the Valand Academy from 1931-1935. He traveled for studies in France, Switzerland, Norway, Denmark, Germany, and Czechoslovakia. He worked as a freelancer and was also a substitute drawing teacher at several places such as Vasa School and Gothenburg School of Arts and Crafts. He had a special interest in portrait painting and illustrated several books. In 1946, his works were exhibited at the Gothenburg Museum, and he completed a mural in the Schwedenhaus in Zurich in 1947. His hand-printed fabrics were displayed at the National Museum, Röhsska Museum, and Liljevalch's in Stockholm. He was a member of the Swedish Artist Association, Swedish Handicrafts Association, and Palette d'Or and was a honorary member of the Instituto de Cultura Americana in 1946 and the Accademia Culturale Adriatica in Milan in 1947. He was also on the board for the Societas Sanctae Apolloniae and belonged to the Swedish Fleet Association, Swedish Journalist Association from 1935-1939, Gothenburg Motor Club, Gothenburg Craftsmen, and the Stockholm Craftsmen Guild in 1947. His hobby was creating ex libris prints. He received the Ordre Universel du Mérite Humain and was a honorary member of the Societas Sanctae Apolloniae.

structured.name: Åke Bertil Brovik

education.name: School of Arts and Crafts in Gothenburg

structured.description: Åke Bertil Brovik was a Swedish artist known for his portrait paintings. He was born in 1911 in Gothenburg to V.E. Nilsson, a Police Commissioner, and Hulda Svenungsson. He married Birgit Wirde in 1939 and they had two children, Ingela and Bertil. He completed his studies at Valand Academy and the School of Arts and Crafts in Gothenburg. He traveled for studies in France, Switzerland, Norway, Denmark, Germany, and Czechoslovakia. He worked as a freelancer and was also a substitute drawing teacher at several places such as Vasa School and Gothenburg School of Arts and Crafts, and illustrated several books. In 1946, his works were exhibited at the Gothenburg Museum, and he completed a mural in the Schwedenhaus in Zurich in 1947. His hand-printed fabrics were displayed at several museums. His hobby was creating ex libris prints. He received several awards, including the Ordre Universel du Mérite Humain and was a honorary member of the Societas Sanctae Apolloniae.
